Package com.google.mu.util

Class BiOptional<A,​B>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.mu.util.BiOptional<A,​B>
  • public abstract class BiOptional<A,​B>
extends java.lang.Object
    An optional pair
    Since:
    5.0

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static <A,​B>
      BiOptional<A,​B>      		 both​(java.util.Optional<A> a, java.util.Optional<B> b)
      Returns an instance wrapping non-null pair (a.get(), b.get()) if both are present, or else returns empty instance.
      static <A,​B>
      BiOptional<A,​B>      		 empty()
      Returns an empty (absent) instance.

      Returns BiOptional wrapping the results of applying the toA and toB functions on the valued wrapped in optional if it's present, or else returns empty().

        Joins the pair using the mapper function.

        Returns Optional.empty() if the pair is absent or if mapper returns null.

      • filter

                                                                      throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
        Returns this BiOptional object as is if the pair is present and matches predicate, or else returns empty().
        Throws:

      • match

        public abstract <E extends java.lang.Throwable> boolean match​(CheckedBiPredicate<? super A,​? super B,​E> predicate)
                                                       throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
        Returns true if the pair is present and matches predicate. Prefer to use 
        
 if (optional.match((a, b) -> a > b)) {...}
        as opposed to 
        
 if (optional.filter((a, b) -> a > b).isPresent()) {...}
        Throws:
        E extends java.lang.Throwable
